content:
Built an automated Inventory forecast model utilized in Annual Sales and 
Operations planning process by leveraging data from various functional areas 
to estimate inventory levels and related operating expenses
EV Charging OEM
(Inventory Model)
1

INVENTORY MODEL FOR ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT MANUFACTURER (OEM) FOR EVs
SITUATION
▪
Client lacked visibility into the financial impact of inventory levels at various warehouses across product lines, due to lack of consolidated data 
repository for Sales, Operations and Finance functions
▪
Merilytics partnered with the client to set up automated reporting of inventory levels and build an inventory forecast model, to help track inventory 
levels, and have clear view of the operating expenses
▪
Created an automated tool that consolidates data from source systems of Sales, Operation and Finance functions (SAP, Salesforce, Sage and 
offline Excel files), to create a single central repository of the data and set up the data/analytics models to support the reporting/analytics 
▪
Set up a model that provides visibility into current inventory levels and forecasts the future inventory positions for the next financial year, by 
analyzing forecasted demand for all product categories against lead times, and production constraints led by semi-conductors shortage
VALUE ADDITION
IMPACT
ABOUT THE CLIENT
Client is an Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) for Electric Vehicles serving customers in over 50 countries, with manufacturing plants across the globe
▪
Results from the analysis helped in estimating the operating expenses for Annual Operations Planning, and streamlining the supply chain 
processes such as sourcing, production planning, raw material procurement etc.  
▪
Consolidated data repository led to flagging of inventory accounting discrepancies of €10M, that helped streamlining the accounting and 
provisioning modules
▪
Automated data consolidation processes helped save up to 40 FTE-hours per month
2

METHODOLOGY/ APPROACH
Product Costing Data
(Business Control)
Production Constraints
(Operations)
Sales Forecast
(Sales)
Inventory Write-off Analysis
(Inventory Accounting)
Current Inventory
(Data Warehouse)
Macro based update system to extract data from all 
sources, and structure in described format with a 
single button click
Net Inventory Calculation
Production lead time analysis is applied with 
specific lead times to each product category
Supply vs Demand Analysis to determine the 
inventory quantities at each warehouse based on 
production constraints and lead times
Net Inventory + Supply & Demand effect rolled up 
for all months with a VBA code-based update 
system for storing inventory snapshots for forecast 
accuracy calculation
Inputs
Intermediate Analysis
Output
3

MONTHLY INVENTORY ACTUALS VS FORECAST PERFORMANCE

Actuals vs Forecasted expenses
